title: I think we can all agree that at the very least ALLY unit block shouldn't exist.
body:
Sure, maybe I should get punished if I chase through an enemy minion wave and get creep blocked all over the place.

Getting punished by my OWN minions on the other hand makes no sense whatsoever in any universe under any circumstances.

I mean, I've seen instances where a huge wave of minions should take a tower but literally half of the Caster minions are bugging out instead of attacking because they all unit blocked each other.

Like, instances of ally minion vs ally minion unit block ALONE is probably enough to warrant removing ally minion block.

SO... about this.

I know HotS is a very different game in core fundamentals, but they don't have ally-creep block, and they DO have skillshots.

And yes, you use your creeps to shield 'first target' shots. That's why a lot of HotS spells rely on first 'hero' hit, and actually /can't/ be used to farm creeps at all.

I prefer that, to the frustratingly idiotic knock-about the creeps do in LoL. Enemy creeps fucking me up is at least logical. My own getting me killed because they forced a double-back at the worst possible second is something else.

I've been playing a bunch of HotS (in fact it was one of the main reasons I made this thread). Enemy minion block is perfectly fair. Being able to dodge skill shots in your minion wave is perfectly fair (this coming from a Jaina main who doesn't take the talent that allows my Q to pass through units after it hits something).

I think this is the long gone connection to Dota, you see in dota you can stand behind your minions when coming to lane to make your minions come closer to your tower. Thus enemy minions end up pushing into you and you get advantage in lane. There are also several other tricks you could do with minion block, so I think Riot said they needed it for future concepts and champions.

Have you tried playing Urgot and pass through your Casters? 
It will make you go around them and screw your Shotguns which have 30 fucking seconds cooldown early game.
On top of that it will make you push the wave in instances where you don't want to, since you have to last hit from different angles.

Works both ways. Ever wondered how you beat a melee champ that's in your face as a ranged champ? Easy, walk circles around their minions wave while they try to get to you. Every disadvantage you have is a disadvantage shared by opponents. Rather than ask for an advantage for yourself, look for ways to abuse the disadvantage in the other guy.
You can also use it in reverse and block your minions paths. It sets at least the first wave closer to your tower than the enemies.
No at the verry least minions blocking minions should not exist.
Not happening. It either has to be all block or no block. Otherwise a ranged champion will literally kite melee through his free Azir walls like every game.
Buff Blitzcrank then

Actually, here's an idea.
Keep everything the same.
But, for allied minions, make it so that when they have signals to move but they find themselves not moving, they should look for nearby champions and move out the way if the champion is there.
This way, laners can't just stand on top of minions, and we I won't get stuck between a tower and a minion for the billionth time.
Keep the physical body of champions and minions, but make minions get budged out the way if they're physically blocking a champion.

Also, with how huge Cho'Gath can get, just imagine what a team full of burst mages and ADCs can do with him blocking ALL the damage. Cho'Gath is strong enough already..

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-rainbows}}

EDIT: TL;DR Some cases are just annoying (like getting stuck in a tower thanks to a single minion). But most the time it's an integral part of the game. We should worry about the important bit (the annoying one) instead of the whole thing.

Getting stuck on allied minions isn't my problem.. **the fact that I get stuck on other allied players is a WHOLE. DIFFERENT. STORY.**

But an easy way of fixing minion block as a whole:

If champion has atleast 2x the health of a minion; then champion gets pathing priority.
If champion has atleast 2x the health of another champion; then larger hp champion gets pathing priority.

Can we stop whining about bodies having mass?
If you didn't have enemy minion collision, the game would suddenly vastly favor faster champs.
If the game didn't have allied minion collision, they would be far to easily used as a wall and higher level players would lose another facet of wave manipulation. 
If allied champions didn't have unit collision then tiny yordles would far too easily hide in allied tanks. 

Just learn to play with the game as it is and GET OVER IT.
